trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_SEQ_00<tab>Pameka's quill is primed and ready.

TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_SEQ_01<tab>Pameka will soon be welcoming Zemoweni to her stall, and she requires bookbinding materials before his arrival. She leaves the matter of the cover up to your expert judgment, and requests the necessary components at your earliest convenience.
※Minimum collectability rating for this delivery is 170. Delivering items with a rating of 340 or more will earn greater rewards.

TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_SEQ_02<tab>With the cover parts secured, you join Zemoweni as he recounts a folktale of the Hanuhanu's arrival in Tural. The story is filled with wind and wonder, and you are motivated to craft a fitting cover to match its contents. Pameka is content with your craftsmanship, and eagerly awaits the next opportunity to collaborate.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_TODO_00<tab>Deliver the handcrafted cover components to Pameka.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_ZEMOWENI_000_001<tab>As soon as my shift is over, I'll pay you both a visit at Pameka's stall. Until then!
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_PAMEKA_000_010<tab>You seem eager to start, and I'll admit─so am I!
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_PAMEKA_100_010<tab>According to my research, we'll require numerous components: boards, covers, woven cords...the list goes on.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_PAMEKA_000_011<tab>Furthermore, a binding can be made of nearly anything. Wood, cloth, leather...the possibilities are endless.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_PAMEKA_000_012<tab>I'll leave the particulars to you and your artistic tastes. Once you have enough materials prepared, we will be ready to document Zemoweni's tales.

TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_SYSTEM_000_013<tab>You may now undertake deliveries for Epistles by Pameka. By delivering the requested items to Pameka and raising yourself in her esteem, you will be able to bind new stories for Zemoweni.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_SYSTEM_000_014<tab>Items with a higher collectability will result in greater rewards upon delivery. Speak to Pameka to view the delivery list.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_PAMEKA_000_100<tab>How goes the crafting, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>?
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_PAMEKA_000_101<tab>Yes, this should serve our purposes beautifully. What sort of book will it become, I wonder?

TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_PAMEKA_000_102<tab>My word... I knew you were an accomplished <var 28 ((ClassJob)) E94501 /var>, but your craftsmanship has surpassed every expectation. The finished product will be a sight to behold.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_SYSTEM_000_103<tab>In making your first successful delivery, you have begun to earn Pameka's trust.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_SYSTEM_000_104<tab>Deliver the items Pameka needs, and deliver them often to bind Zemoweni's tales into captivating tomes!
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_PAMEKA_000_105<tab>Now, then. Whenever you are ready, Zemoweni, we may begin.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_ZEMOWENI_000_106<tab>I think I'll start with a famous tale that has been passed down across generations of Hanuhanu.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_ZEMOWENI_000_107<tab>It is a tale of their benevolent god, and of the crop that would enrich their very way of life.

TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_ZEMOWENI_000_108<tab>Long, long ago, the Hanuhanu resided in a land beyond the clouds. Though their heavenly home was frigid, their enemies were few, and they whiled away their days dancing in the pale warmth of the sun.

TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_ZEMOWENI_000_109<tab>But one day, a great storm ravaged these clear blue skies. The wind and rains raged upon those lands so fiercely, it sent a pair of Hanuhanu tumbling down to the waters below...
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_ZEMOWENI_000_110<tab>Yet what should appear but a giant bird, as big as an island! It flew up and caught the Hanuhanu upon its back.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_ZEMOWENI_000_111<tab>The kindly bird sailed upon the winds, over the great, blue ocean, until finally it came to a land kissed by dawn─the land we call Tural.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_ZEMOWENI_000_112<tab>The couple was grateful to stand on solid ground again. But their journey had exhausted them, and their energies were spent.

TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_ZEMOWENI_000_113<tab>They searched high and low for something to fill their empty bellies, and it was there that they found the great bird once again, feasting upon verdant reeds.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_ZEMOWENI_000_114<tab>The Hanuhanu followed suit. One taste of the sweet reeds filled them with vigor, and their feathers began to glisten with every color of the rainbow.

TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_ZEMOWENI_000_115<tab>It was then that the couple knew this great bird to be the god Kixaihih. They tended the reeds in its honor, and their brood would grow and prosper, becoming the Hanuhanu we know today.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_PAMEKA_000_116<tab>What do you think so far, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>? Have you any inspiration for a suitable cover?
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_PAMEKA_000_117<tab>Splendid! I suspect Zemoweni will have a few more Hanuhanu stories to tell before we conclude here. We ought to construct our cover in the meantime.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_SYSTEM_000_119<tab>With your painstakingly prepared materials, you produce a cover befitting Zemoweni's first batch of tales.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_SYSTEM_000_120<tab>You carefully bind Pameka's pages into the fold...and the tome is complete!
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_ZEMOWENI_000_121<tab>It's...it's a real book! I may not be able to read it yet, but just looking at it fills me with joy.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_PAMEKA_000_122<tab>Books are remarkable things, indeed. Stories told in speech alone will disappear with their tellers─but what is written is promised to survive.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_PAMEKA_000_123<tab>But that's my own romanticism showing through. More importantly, I greatly enjoyed your storytelling, Zemoweni.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_Q1_000_000<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_A1_000_001<tab>About the Hanuhanu who once lived above the clouds...
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_A1_000_002<tab>I'm glad I could learn more about Hanuhanu mythology.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_PAMEKA_000_125<tab>A people called the Vanu Vanu, you say? From your description, they do sound like they might share common roots with Tural's Hanuhanu.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_PAMEKA_000_126<tab>The god's name was Kixaihih, correct? If I'm not mistaken, the Landsguard's crest also depicts a great avian creature...perhaps it has some relation?
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_ZEMOWENI_000_127<tab>If you enjoyed those tales, I know plenty more like them.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_ZEMOWENI_000_128<tab>For example, the ones I heard the other day from a Pelupelu patron were fascinating─theirs is a people with a talent for words!
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_ZEMOWENI_100_128<tab>I'll have to practice ahead of time if I'm to do them any justice.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_PAMEKA_000_129<tab>Please do! We'll be happy to hear them whenever you feel ready.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_PAMEKA_000_130<tab>...And so ends our first job! You were a pleasure to work with, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, and I have a feeling you'll continue to impress.
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_SYSTEM_000_131<tab>Pameka is pleased with your efforts. She now considers you a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Cover Collaborator<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>!
TEXT_KINGLA202_04976_SYSTEM_000_132<tab>The next request will be available from Pameka upon reaching level 93 as a carpenter, leatherworker, or weaver.
